entries: {@i The Magaambya is an academic organization founded by Old-Mage Jatembe and his Ten Magic Warriors during the Age of Anguish, teaching both magic and alchemy, self-reliance and teamwork, and diplomacy as well as force for good. It is a community built on the strength of thousands before it, and you now get to be one of them.}

entries.name: The Magaambyan Guide
entries: This guide is a consolidation of all the information across all {@i Strength of Thousands} adventure paths, as well as relevant bits from {@i Lost Omens: The Mwangi Expanse} and {@i Lost Omens: Legends}. It is intended to be a guide for Gamemasters, which I strongly recommend to selectively copy and share portions of this document to your players for referencing and becoming accustomed to the setting. It also includes homebrew rules for discovering NPCs sheets, and more concrete rules for the Academic System than included in the original adventure, as that is a bit too freeform.

Below you will also have all of the available information about the adventure's students, teachers, branches, buildings, and as the adventure takes place in Nantambu, Nantambu itself as well. Each entry will have it's sources listed and cited.

If you have any questions or suggestions, you can contact MrVauxs#8622 on the Pf2e.Tools {@link Discord|https://discord.gg/2hzNxErtVu} or make a pull request modifying the homebrew in the {@link GitHub Homebrew Repo|https://github.com/Pf2eToolsOrg/homebrew}.

entries.name: Homebrew Disclaimer
entries: This document includes homebrew made by various members of the Pathfinder 2e community as well as original work by MrVauxs. Any and all homebrew that comes from a different author than the one of this document will be attributed with a {@note note}.
Any homebrew additions to official content will also be formatted with special homebrew tags, shown below.

entries.name: Homebrew
entries: Such as homebrew sections like these.

entries.name: Homebrew which changed something
entries: It also supports changes, which show the replaced entries on hover.

oldEntries: And can also mark moved content.

data.name: NPCs
entries: This section is dedicated to all Non-Playable Characters in the Strength of Thousands adventure path. There are four categories of NPCs:

Each category should be self-explanatory, with the exception of Minor NPCs. Minor NPCs are NPCs that appear in the adventure but don't serve a bigger purpose than the one you and your players give them past their initial introduction, nor have a specified role such as a Student. An example of such an NPC is {@creature Binji|SoT1}.

items.name: Anchor Root
entries: An anxious female ant gnoll, Anchor Root appears at the beginning and at the end of the adventure path. She can be first seen in the first adventure, {@i Kindled Magic}, but also right at the end in {@i Shadow of the Ancients} where the heroes have to save Anchor Root from the effects of the Vesciant Egg which turned her {@creature Unshadowed Anchor Root|SoT6|Unshadowed}.
Similarly, any artwork containing Anchor Root can only be found on page 67 of {@i Kindled Magic} and her unshadowed "evil" version on page 23 of {@i Shadow of the Ancients}.

items.name: Branch
entries: Rain-Scribes

items.name: Classroom Advantage
entries: Treat your critical failures when you {@action Study|SoT1} for Rain-Scribe classes as failures instead.

items.name: Specialty Item
entries: {@item rhythm bone|sot1}

items.name: Notable Skills
entries: {@skill Nature}, {@skill Occultism}, {@skill Stealth}, {@skill Survival}

items.name: Hobbies
entries: sand sculptures, raising beetles, musical curation

items.name: Most Well Known For
entries: interrupting herself halfway through a presentation to exclaim "I'm sorry, I'm boring you" and running out of the room crying

items.name: Strangest Quirk
entries: uses a chicken tied to a stick to keep her room free of unwanted bugs

items.name: Common Associates
entries: Esi (working on music playback magic), Noxolo (scavenging bones), Tzeniwe (stress baking)

Anchor Root is an {@ancestry GNOLL|LOME|ant gnoll|ANT}, a 3-foot-tall humanoid who resembles an aardwolf more than a deadly carnivore. She hails from the small Redridge clan, several weeks' travel south-west from the Magaambya. Her clan has been in decline for several decades, with important storytellers and religious leaders dying before suitable replacements could be trained. Anchor Root is the only child in the clan with the potential talent to replace Redridge's aging bonekeeper. Anchor Root's entire family has placed their hopes on the young gnoll—unfortunately, Anchor Root's temperament is ill-suited to such pressure. Though she has always had issues with anxiety, the expectations currently placed on her shoulders have left her in a constant state of panic. The slightest flaw in her work or actions, whether real or perceived, can leave Anchor Root a devastated wreck for days.

Anchor Root takes her role as bonekeeper-in-training very seriously, even though she isn't sure she's up to the task. She is always on the lookout for the bones of worthy creatures—gnolls or otherwise—that can be symbolically adopted by her troubled clan to serve as spiritual mentors and protectors. The gnoll also has a hobby of anonymously recording music played around the city and then working with other students to play back the music on campus for others to hear.

entries.name: Notes
entries: Her statblock in {@i Shadow of the Ancients} show her as a Primal caster first and foremost, but also includes Occult spellcasting. Whether or not it is because of the effect of the Vesciant Egg is unclear.

items.name: Chizire
entries: The easygoing male catfolk, Chizire welcomes the players to their dormitory with mango and moonshine at the beginning of the adventure path. He appears in the {@i Kindled Magic}, briefly in {@i Spoken on the Song Wind} and lastly has to be saved from an {@creature Grendel|Bst2|Infused Ogre} of his own doing in {@i Shadow of the Ancients}.
The only artwork of Chizire is on page 68 of {@i Kindled Magic}.

items.name: Branch
entries: Cascade Bearers

items.name: Classroom Advantage
entries: You don't get tired after you {@action Cram|SoT1} for Cascade Bearer classes.

items.name: Specialty Item
entries: {@spell verminous lure|sot1}

items.name: Notable Skills
entries: {@skill Crafting}, {@skill Deception}, {@skill Diplomacy}, {@skill Nature}

items.name: Hobbies
entries: brewing, engineering, finding new and exciting ways to avoid work

items.name: Most Well Known For
entries: building a complete moonshine still in his dorm room from scrap

items.name: Strangest Quirk
entries: always knowing the answer when called on despite visibly sleeping through class

items.name: Common Associates
entries: Haibram (drinking partner), Ignaci (brewing experimental elixirs), Mariama (brewing weird liquors), Okoro (gaming group)

Chizire spent most of his youth in {@place Kibwe} unable to read, no matter how many books he was given or how many lessons were drilled into his head. By the time a visiting scholar encountered Chizire and recognized the youth was dyslexic, Chizire had already embraced the role of slacker and screw-up that had been thrust upon him. Despite this, Chizire's keen ability to teach himself magic and science caught the scholar's eye, even if the catfolk mostly used his gifts to keep slugs out of his fermentation barrels.

Chizire thrives at the Magaambya, though he often uses his intelligence for disruptive jokes, complex pranks, and other hijinks disapproved of by the faculty. He infuriates most of his mentors—and some of the students— by refusing to make anything of himself, despite clearly understanding the lessons better than many of his peers.

Chizire is known for his daring antics, such as infiltrating the kitchen or stealing magic items from campus, but his ultimate goal for the year is to enchant one of Nantambu's 10 pillar landmarks to tell bawdy jokes. Getting past all the magical wards on the pillars would be an incredible challenge, but Chizire thinks he can manage it with a bit of help, provided no one snitches on him to the teachers.

items.name: Esi Djana
entries: Esi Djana, a gifted female human student is the first of many who meets and welcomes the players to their at the beginning of the adventure path. She appears in the {@i Kindled Magic}, and briefly appearing in {@i Shadow of the Ancients} as "a busy teacher rumored to be well on her way to becoming the Learned One of the Tempest-Sun Mages".
The only artwork of her is on page 68 of {@i Kindled Magic}.

items.name: Branch
entries: Tempest-Sun Mages

items.name: Classroom Advantage
entries: Treat your successes to {@action Study|SoT1} for Tempest-Sun Mage classes as critical successes instead.

items.name: Specialty Item
entries: {@spell impeccable flow|sot1}

items.name: Notable Skills
entries: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Diplomacy}, {@skill Society}

items.name: Hobbies
entries: university administration, campus exploration, book printing, book binding, sports, tactical wargames, fashion contests

items.name: Most Well Known For
entries: once spent 15 straight minutes reciting different synonyms for "wrong" to make a point in an argument

items.name: Strangest Quirk
entries: leaving baubles at magically derived coordinates for others to find

items.name: Common Associates
entries: Anchor Root (working on musical playback magic), Haibram and Mariama (sparring partners), Okoro (exercise partner), Tzeniwe (babysitting)

Every school has its star students, and anyone who knows Esi Djana knows that she's one of them. A Nantambu native, Esi engages the academy with an energy few can match. On any given day, Esi can be found organizing students for study groups and extracurricular activities, commanding the field for several of Nantambu's sports teams, independently researching foreign policy and military defense tactics, and still finding time for an active social life and dates with similarly ambitious young men. Esi is also known for around campus being kind, passionate, and genuine, going out of her way to approach shier or more anxious students who seem to have trouble making friends. Determined to follow in the footsteps of her Tempest-Sun Mage mother, whom she idolizes, Esi is a student who is clearly going places—a fact that attracts admirers, detractors, and opportunists in equal measure.

Esi's obstacles stem from her strengths. The young woman is not shy about challenging her teachers, or the academy administration itself, when she feels something can be done better. While some teachers encourage her spirited initiative (Takulu Ot perhaps most of all), others can be dismissive or outright hostile.

items.name: Haibram Thodja
entries: The reckless male dwarf, Haibram Thodja, appears in {@i Kindled Magic} as a fellow student, followed by an appearance in {@i Doorway to the Red Star} in an event partaking flying an airship. Lastly, he is found in {@i Shadow of the Ancients} under the influence of the Vesciant Egg in an {@creature Unshadowed Haibram|SoT6|Unshadowed} form.
There's artwork of Haibram on page 66 and 69 of {@i Kindled Magic}, as well as his unshadowed form in {@i Shadows of the Ancients} on page 24.

items.name: Branch
entries: Rain-Scribes

items.name: Classroom Advantage
entries: When you {@action Cram|SoT1} for Rain-Scribe classes, you can {@action Study|SoT1} three times rather than twice.

items.name: Specialty Item
entries: {@spell airburst|sot1}

items.name: Notable Skills
entries: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Survival}

items.name: Hobbies
entries: recreational combat, cloudwatching, hang-gliding, pyromania

items.name: Most Well Known For
entries: jumping off a three-story building to win a game of tag

items.name: Strangest Quirk
entries: constantly found at the scene of fires that are actually never his fault

items.name: Common Associates
entries: Chizire (drinking partner), Esi and Mariama (sparring partners)

Haibram's philosophy in life could be summed up as "go hard or go home." Though on the whole a friendly person, the Mbe'ke dwarf approaches anything resembling a competition with perhaps a little too much enthusiasm. While most of his idiosyncrasies are harmless, such as entering footraces in full battle armor, others demonstrate a rash impulsiveness, such as the time he leapt out brandishing an axe during an Uzunjati scary story competition. For those who aren't put off by his wild antics, Haibram can be the highlight of any party. Whether it's rockclimbing, rooftop races at midnight, or igniting colorful explosives, his exploits almost always make for interesting stories.

Though Haibram's natural magical mastery is focused on the element of air, his true enthusiasm is fire. It's an open secret Haibram wants to join the Tempest-Sun Mages and rain destruction down on his foes, but the branch's obligation to defend (and thus remain near) the Magaambya has left him unwilling to commit. For now, he satisfies himself with learning how to survive and thrive in any circumstances by studying under the Rain-Scribes. He skillfully combines physical combat with magic, using wind to dart across the battlefield or add hurricane force to thrown mambeles and swung clubs.

entries.name: Notes
entries: His statblock in {@i Shadow of the Ancients} show him as an Arcane caster and able to use his Wind powers with extreme mobility.

items.name: Ignaci Canterells
entries: The secretive male human, Ignaci Canterells, appears in {@i Kindled Magic} as a fellow student, in {@i Hurricane's Howl}, close to becoming a Lore-Speaker, and lastly he appears in {@i Shadow of the Ancients}, the heroes having to save his life a second time, first time in {@i Kindled Magic} from a bee sting allergy, while in {@i Shadow of the Ancients} from a failed experiment involving acid.
There's artwork of Ignaci on page 66 and 69 of {@i Kindled Magic}.

items.name: Branch
entries: Emerald Boughs

items.name: Classroom Advantage
entries: When you {@action Cram|sot1} for Emerald Boughs classes, treat your critical failures as failures instead.

items.name: Specialty Item
entries: {@item forgetful ink|sot1}

items.name: Notable Skills
entries: {@skill Crafting}, {@skill Society}, {@skill Stealth}, {@skill Thievery}

items.name: Hobbies
entries: cryptography, high fashion, covert explorations

items.name: Most Well Known For
entries: being easily swayed into bad decisions by attractive men

items.name: Strangest Quirk
entries: starting his assignments over from the beginning every time he makes a mistake

items.name: Common Associates
entries: Chizire (brewing experimental elixirs), Noxolo and Tzeniwe (sewing clothing), Okoro (cleaning house in card games, being talked into bad decisions)

Born in the colony of Sargava before it became the nation of Vidrian, Ignaci earned his parents’ disapproval through the company he kept—rebellious youths, disaffected soldiers, and the native Mwangi populace. This minor rebellion proved enough for Ignaci’s colonist family to abandon him at the start of the Vidric Revolution, deliberately stranding the teenager amid the violent chaos. Ignaci joined the fight for Vidrian’s freedom, in part for justice but mainly driven by a hatred of his family and everyone like them. Ignaci hopes to one day aid Vidrian against foreign interests.

The trauma of these experiences taught Ignaci three lessons: shut up, keep your head down, and trust no one. Though his work ethic, politeness, and intelligence all impress his teachers, he avoids attention and has no close friends. He also remains incredibly paranoid, writing all of his study notes in a secret code.

Ignaci spends most of his free time stealthily exploring the school’s nooks and crannies, leaving coded notes to himself in an ink that is visible only when exposed to a special alchemical light. Unknown to him, other students have discovered these notes, mistaken them for something more significant, and formed a small group called the Cryptic Circle that is dedicated to solving them.

items.name: Mariama Keitana
entries: The erratic female human, Mariama Keitana, appears in {@i Kindled Magic} as a fellow student, in {@i Hurricane's Howl}, close to becoming a Lore-Speaker, and lastly appears in {@i Shadow of the Ancients}, having become {@creature Unshadowed Mariama|SOT6|Unshadowed}.
There's artwork of Mariama on page 70 of {@i Kindled Magic} and 21 of {@i Shadow of the Ancients}.

items.name: Branch
entries: Cascade Bearers

items.name: Classroom Advantage
entries: You can reroll a check to {@action Study|sot1} for a Cascade Bearer class; this is a {@trait fortune} effect.

items.name: Specialty Item
entries: {@optfeature Lesson of Calamity|sot1}

items.name: Notable Skills
entries: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Occultism}, {@skill Religion}

items.name: Hobbies
entries: combat theory, occult lore, linguistics

items.name: Most Well Known For
entries: summoning a devil on accident during a complex mathematical proof

items.name: Strangest Quirk
entries: knows swear words in almost every language on Golarion

items.name: Common Associates
entries: Chizire (brewing weird liquors), Okoro (board games), Esi and Haibram (sparring partners)

Teachers at the Magaambya tactfully describe Mariama as a student with an “interesting” personality. Undeniably a knowledgeable occultist and accomplished spellcaster, the young woman falters between responsibility and unreliability with infuriating frequency. Her attitude likewise flips between unbearable kindness to her friends and outright viciousness to her foes.

Mariama lives the kind of life that even storytellers might consider unrealistic, with wildly fluctuating luck and outlandish events frequently plaguing her. She likes to tell stories that are even more unbelievable, leaving her fellows to wonder whether Mariama is cursed, blessed, or just a pathological liar. To date, Mariama has nearly started a cult by accident while drunk, been subjected to school discipline for selling curses, and had her heirloom magical staff disintegrated by a freak bolt of lightning.

Mariama can rapidly piece together disparate clues, but her focus on the occult and the exceptional often leads her astray. She’s quick to proclaim supernatural influence where there is none, such as accusing fey for crop failures when quelea birds are to blame. Yet when uncanny forces truly are at work, Mariama’s insights are frighteningly accurate.

entries.name: Notes
entries: It is worth mentioning that in {@i Shadow of the Ancients}, "in a twist of fate that is strangely typical of her life, a {@creature sumbreiva|bst3} and Mariama fell quite suddenly in love".

It is heavily implied Mariama is a member of the {@class Witch|apg} class, with the last adventure including witch-specific features in her {@creature Unshadowed Mariama|SOT6|Unshadowed} statblock. Said statblock also shows that casts only Occult spells and has no other magic traditions at her disposal.

items.name: Noxolo
entries: {@note WIP}
There's artwork of Mariama on page 70 of {@i Kindled Magic} and.

items.name: Branch
entries: Uzunjati

items.name: Classroom Advantage
entries: Treat your critical failures to {@action Study|sot1} in Uzunjati classes as failures instead.

items.name: Specialty Item
entries: {@spell grave impressions|sot1}

items.name: Notable Skills
entries: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Performance}, {@skill Religion}

items.name: Hobbies
entries: dance, high fashion, kite-flying, watching motes of dust float through the air

items.name: Most Well Known For
entries: pausing to dance and sing about what she’s doing when excited

items.name: Strangest Quirk
entries: always uses murder in her hypothetical examples

items.name: Common Associates
entries: Anchor Root (scavenging bones), Ignaci and Tzeniwe (discussing fashion)

Noxolo fled from her home to escape her overbearing family, who had planned out every aspect of her life. Whispers from dead birds and cow bones told her she could find freedom at the Magaambya, and so she went, not knowing what to expect. What she discovered was a far bigger world than she’d ever dreamt possible, and a chance to unravel the mysteries of the strange whispers she hears. Though highly prone to spacing out during lectures, Noxolo does her best not to take her acceptance at the Magaambya for granted. The transition has been rougher on her than she likes to admit, however, and she often finds herself wracked with homesickness and guilt for leaving the family who cared enough about her to plan her life in such detail.

Noxolo dressed as a man to avoid being tracked down while traveling, noticing that many overlooked someone who appeared to be a man if they were searching for a woman. By the time she reached the Magaambya, Noxolo found she preferred her new look and has begun to experiment with various fashions and hairstyles.

Noxolo is accompanied at all times by a bizarre, 2-foot-long pet she refers to as her “snabble,” a creature that resembles a fuzzy cross between a crocodile and a bear cub. The creature has attracted more than its fair share of curious scholars, though Noxolo herself seems uninterested in what sort of creature it truly is or where it originally came from.

items.name: Okoro Obiyo
entries: {@note WIP}
There's artwork of Mariama on page 71 of {@i Kindled Magic} and.

items.name: Branch
entries: Uzunjati

items.name: Classroom Advantage
entries: You don’t get tired after you {@action Cram|SoT1} for Uzunjati classes.

items.name: Specialty Item
entries: {@spell mind games|sot1}

items.name: Notable Skills
entries: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Diplomacy}, {@skill Performance}, {@skill Occultism}

items.name: Hobbies
entries: sports, board games, card games, deep research dives into random topics

items.name: Most Well Known For
entries: preparing an 8-hour presentation on a completely different topic than the teacher assigned

items.name: Strangest Quirk
entries: is scared of butterflies

items.name: Common Associates
entries: Chizire and Mariama (gaming group), Esi (exercise partner), Ignaci (talking him into bad decisions)

A bright-eyed and excitable Bonuwat youth from Senghor, Okoro’s love of eclectic research got him shipped off to the Magaambya to hone his talents and, some joke, to spare everyone else in Senghor from his enthusiasm. To Okoro, whatever has caught his interest for the month is the most exciting thing ever, and nothing can pry his attention and passion away from it. The self-directed nature of the Magaambya’s classes has allowed him to pursue these interests more often than a typical university, and Okoro is considered one of the top students at his rank. His relentless positivity in the face of challenges, setbacks, and the occasional near-death experience have likewise gained him many friends. Though his confidence and gusto can occasionally lead him to being shortsighted and even self-centered, most find him to be a bright spot in a complicated world.

Okoro is a natural athlete who excelled at aquatic sports in Senghor and now enjoys footraces and kickball in Nantambu. He also possesses a truly staggering collection of board games and card decks, and periodically drags fellow students into playing them. His most successful endeavor is his biweekly game night, often compete for favors, magical formulas, or campus secrets.

entries.name: Notes
entries: His statblock in {@i Shadow of the Ancients} show him as an Occult caster and a skilled archer. He also has a lot of abilities centered around luck.

items.name: Strands-Of-Glowing-Dawn Tzeniwe
entries: {@note WIP}
There's artwork of Mariama on page 71 of {@i Kindled Magic} and.

items.name: Branch
entries: Emerald Boughs

items.name: Classroom Advantage
entries: Treat your successes to {@action Study|sot1} for Emerald Boughs classes as critical successes instead, but this doesn’t apply when you {@action Cram|sot1}.

items.name: Specialty Item
entries: {@spell friendfetch|sot1}

items.name: Notable Skills
entries: {@skill Crafting}, {@skill Diplomacy}, {@skill Performance}, {@skill Society}

items.name: Hobbies
entries: bird-watching, baking, high fashion

items.name: Most Well Known For
entries: having elaborate themed outfits for every class

items.name: Strangest Quirk
entries: leaving hidden anonymous gifts for people

items.name: Common Associates
entries: Anchor Root (stress baking), Esi (babysitting), Ignaci and Noxolo (weaving cloth and sewing clothing)

A middle-aged woman who stands out among her younger peers, Tzeniwe sought the Magaambya later in life to gain an advanced education in the hopes of passing that education down to her children. A shy and awkward person from the nation of Nurvatcha, Tzeniwe knows that many in the Mwangi Expanse mistakenly believe shapeshifting anadis to be humans who turn into hideous spider creatures at night. Though the Magaambya possess’s a much more enlightened view on anadis, Tzeniwe is still painfully aware that many humanoids are terrified of spiders. Indeed, she’s more forgiving of repulsed reactions than her friends think she should be. Possessing a cooperative and generous nature, Tzeniwe often leaves her peers small gifts to make them comfortable, such as cups of chilled tea, delicious snacks, or even soft scarves and kaftans.

Despite her introversion, Tzeniwe’s two toddlers constantly pull her out of her shell. Named Zachva and Zanvi, the rambunctious pair have no qualms about jumping around in spider form, pestering other students, or climbing into places they shouldn’t. Academy students have become impressed with Tzeniwe’s ability to lasso her children from over 50 paces to retrieve them. Though Tzeniwe usually carries them with her during classes, a large spiderling on her back and a human child on one knee, she often asks others to watch them when the twins refuse to behave.

data.name: Nantambu
entries: In addition to what information {@book Lost Omens: The Mwangi Expanse|LOME|11} might provide, here are additional notes worth having when reading the book:

items: {@b Natofo} from {@i The Carnivorous Gardens} appears in {@i Spoken on the Song Wind}, asking for help with Oozes having gotten out of control in her gardens.

{@b "Fire-Pot" Ubanu} from the {@i Fire-Pot’s Forge} appears in {@i Spoken on the Song Wind}, committing arson upon the Magaambya to send a message about wanting to be repaid for his services, as he's been scammed by two Serpentfolk disgusing themselves as Magaambya Students.
{@b Asanda} plays an important role in {@i Spoken on the Song Wind}, having been kidnapped and impersonated by Serpentfolk.

entries: Below is also a table summarising the various prominent locations in Nantambu, with suggestions on their usage in the campaign. It is recommended that for {@action Earn Income} levels to not go above the Settlements level, which is 10.
{@action Earn Income} with {@skill Survival} to gather unique plants to the area, unable to grow anywhere else.
{@action Practical Research|SOT1} with {@skill Nature} or {@skill Lore} to identify and catalogue plants in that area.
If a player wants to {@action Craft} poisons, it is likely that they will find potent specimens in the area.
It's deadly, mysterious nature might be interesting for players studying in Necromancy.
{@action Gather Information} from nobles and the wealthy populace.
{@action Earn Income} with {@skill Crafting} or {@skill Society} to cook in the restaurant or be a server respectively.
Deliquent players might be interested in breaking into the mysterious restaurant to see what rumoured treasure it might be hiding, or even do a heist!
{@action Earn Income} with {@skill Nature} to maintain the garden.
{@action Earn Income} with {@skill Crafting} to create meat substitutes for the plants.
The place appears in {@i Spoken on the Song Wind} on page 35 in "Oozing into Trouble" task.
It is a common resting place for Zuma, him being a brother of the owner, Natofo.
{@action Earn Income} with {@skill Crafting} to maintain the boats.
{@action Earn Income} with {@skill Athletics} to compete in tournaments.

While Haibram may not be initially interested, his proficiency with wind spells can prove beneficial for any team having him. Compelling him to join the team of the heroes, if they choose to participate in a boat-race is definitely gonna give them a steep advantage.
